headline: Espinacas con Garbanzos (Spinach with Garbanzo Beans)
description: This recipe can be eaten as a side dish or as a light meal. It's great with a grilled pork chop and some crusty bread. Its origins date back to North African cultures and is one of the very popular choices of tapas in Seville's bars.

video.description: Watch how to make this top-rated Spanish recipe.
video.name: Spinach with Garbanzo Beans

name: Espinacas con Garbanzos (Spinach with Garbanzo Beans)
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) box frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained well

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-low heat. Cook the garlic and onion in the oil until translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the spinach, garbanzo beans, cumin, and salt. Use your stirring spoon to lightly mash the beans as the mixture cooks. Allow to cook until thoroughly heated.

review.reviewBody: Unexpectedly great recipe! Frozen Spinach, large can garbanzos, diced onion, 2 rounded teaspoons of garlic bits, then cooked in some pork bone broth leftovers. It didn't last to be leftovers for the next day! Fast & so yummy! Glad I found this!

Simple list of ingredients, easy to throw together. Didn't have time to defrost the spinach, so we'll see. To be honest (TBH), I eyeballed the quantities based on 290 g chickpeas and frozen blocks of spinach: Used 1 whole onion and about 6 cloves of garlic. I could see it with an Indian spice blend, instead of straight cumin. I'd consider using nutritional yeast or pareve (non meat) chicken soup powder instead of the cumin.
Easy and delicious! Used bagged baby spinach and already chopped onion and already minced garlic that I had in the fridge. Took no time at all and tasted excellent!
I used fresh spinach. It was delicious.

We've made this twice and enjoyed it both times. It's now a regular part of our meal planning. The first time we followed the recipe exactly bit did not mash the garbanzos. The second time we tried a suggestion and added paprika. This is a tasty and hearty dish as well as low-carb and diabetic-friendly ! In an effort to reduce sodium, we use low-sodium garbanzos (Kuner's No Salt Added Garbanzos, if that helps). We're not nutritionists, though :-)
Delicious, Surprised by how filling it is! Would make it often!
Delish! Simple prep and wonderful flavor. I used fresh baby spinach but other than that I didn’t deviate from the recipe. Highly recommend!
This is one of my favourite quick and easy recipes. It can be eaten as a meal or a side dish...even tastes great cold. I always add a handful or two of raisins. It kicks it up a notch!

This was so easy and delicious. Made it as posted except used a bag of fresh spinach. Because there is not as much moisture as frozen I added a splash of white wine. Some reviewers said the cumin was too much—I couldn’t even taste it. Next time I may add a small can of Rotel or diced tomatoes, just to see what it is like.

Excellent dish! I was out of cumin so I used coriander and red chili flakes. I used fresh spinach and splash of chicken broth to keep it from being dry. Delicious!!!! And I know it's heresy to the original chef, but this was even better with some fresh asiago shaved on top. I could also see making this with pancetta. This is an excellent side dish or a vegan entree.

Easy, healthy and delicious! I made a few changes: I omitted the salt; added 1/2 tsp. of paprika along with the cumin. I added the spices when sautéing the onion and garlic; and also sautéed slivered almonds. Next I included both the garbanzo beans along with diced tomatoes. And along with raw (rather than frozen spinach) I also included tatsoi, a delicious green that I got from our local CSA.

Really good! I followed the recipe except I used fresh spinach instead of canned and doubled the recipe. We loved it! Came across this recipe because i bought cases of garbanzo beans on accident lol. Served with salmon, dinner salad, and a vegetable medley.

This is a good basis for a great dish. I felt that the ratio of ingredients was spot on. I too added some Smoked Spanish Paprika but I also thought oregano or rosemary would be great addition also. Before serving I mixed in some lemon juice and parsley, because it begs for acid. 
Take aways:
Great solid dish to build upon--probably have these ingredients in many pantrys.
Pairs well with many dishes.
Add your favorite acid: lemon or lime juice, wine, etc...
Add the spinach towards the end to let the beans cook before spinach gets too wilty.

Omg. I did change a couple things, I omitted the cumin and put paprika in its place, used half a bag of fresh spinach and about 3/4 of a can of garbanzos. I cooked the onion with some red pepper flakes before cooking down the spinach half way and then added the beans and about a 1/4 c of broth. Let it simmer until the chickpeas were tender and smashed. Little lemon. Omg best and simplest veg meal I've ever cooked and it reminds me of being in andalucia. Thank you!

My hubby and I really liked this dish! We were surprised because neither of us like garbanzo beans that much. I used fresh spinach followed others advice and added a bit of broth and a squeeze of lemon and some feta cheese. Next time I will use the whole carton of spinach (the organic spinach you get from Costco) there were a few too many garbanzo's. Thanks for a great recipe!

used this recipe many times but changed it to our liking. it's a good, quick, healthy dish. we double the cumin and salt. added pepper and interchange frozen spinach with kale(bought kale on accident and turned out to be a happy accident). sometimes we throw in left over chicken and still is a nice dish.
Very nice & easy side dish. So many ways to season this to delight yourself. Give it a try, you'll love it!

Loved it! The only change I made was I used fresh spinach because that's what I had. The flavors went together well. The next time I make this, I will mash it alittle more. I served it with truscuits and it would stay on the cracker more if it were mashed a bit . Thanks Vanessa
I enjoyed this just as it is but also found a little grated Parmesan cheese on it was also very good.
Love it!
Love this! I added a small can of sliced mushrooms, and cooked chicken. Delicious
Sorry - this just wasn't for me.
This is a tasty little dish!
I added paprika, lemon pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder to add more flavor.
Really good!

Old mother Hubbard went to the cupboard to make dinner, and all she really had was a can of garbanzo beans and a bag of fresh spinach in the fridge. This was amazing and so easy! I loved the cumin, and I feel it would have been bland without it.
Left out the soy sauce. I didn't have a shallot so I added an extra clove of garlic and a sprinkle of nutmeg. Yummy! I'm going to add some Italian sausage next time for a complete meal.
I had to use white beans because I was out of garbanzos. It was good, but needed a little more pizazz. I will probably make it again with garbanzos just because it is so healthy.
Cooked per the recipe but used fresh spinach and added bacon with a little of the bacon grease. Turned out to be a family favorite!
Very good and so easy! I did use fresh spinach though.

Had an earthy flavor, like a kale and quinoa dish I've made. The cumin and extra virgin olive oil are great additions. But, coming from someone who enjoys spinach and chickpeas, the flavor seemed just a bit lacking... like it needed a bit of zest... maybe sundried tomatoes or lemon? I would like to try this again, and add a little something. What to add? I'm not sure. Still, it's definitely a worthwhile recipe, and I did enjoy it.

I lived in Barcelona for 6 years and this was one of my favourites. I add a few toasted pine nuts and a sprinkle of Jerez vinegar. I serve it with a Caprese salad and a butifara. I use Beyond Sausage. This meal puts me right back in beautiful Barcelona.

I made this dish as described but I did take others advice to add some pepper flakes. I also added some oregano which added to the spice flavour profile. I had a bag of fresh spinach blend with kale and chard which also added to the dish.

Made it as is. It's very good. I was a little worried about the cumin. Too much cumin makes food taste soapy to me. (Maybe that's just me.) . But in this case, it was very subtle. I took the leftovers to work for a healthy lunch. Thank you so much for the healthy dish!!
Delicious! I added chicken base instead of salt and Italian seasoning instead of cumin to fit with our Italian meal. I will definitely make again.
Simple and delicious. I use fresh spinach and add lemon juice.
I added shitake mushrooms and matchstick carrots to the saute. A little ume plum vinegar sprinkle and served over short grain brown rice.

this is an excellent combination of flavors and textures.
i substituted 1 tsp of cilantro for the 1/2 tsp of cumin and used fresh spinach
Tasty and healthy!

I added a grain (farro) to this recipe in order to make it a fuller main course dish. I used fresh spinach instead of frozen. I put the espinacas con garbanzos on top of the cooked farro and it was positively delicious and filling. Added extra lemon.
added a wee bit of adobo as well
I followed the suggestion in the video of squeezing a little lemon juice on the finished product. It was much better than I expected. I will make this again. It was quick and easy.

Nice and simple, tasted great. I thought the cumin and the spinach went really well together, but this didn't surprise me--cumin is one of the spices that make palak paneer so delicious! I didn't smash the beans, but I might next time. I might also add a bit of lemon juice or tomato next time. I honestly never bother draining frozen spinach--nine times out of ten the recipe tells you to add water anyway, so why bother? Or else I find I need to add some because things are too dry. Anyway, this was simple to make and tasted great.
Sooooo good.

I love this recipe! And what a bonus being so good for you too! Used double the spinach since it was a 20 oz frozen bag ,added some chicken bouillon and water to cook it for a little bit. It was a wonderful accompaniment to a grilled pork loin. Thanks for posting this recipe!

Healthy, yummy, and CHEAP! 
My family was a bit Leery of it at first.
My Dad and I normally hate cooked spinach. But Dad's words "you managed to make cooked spinach really good! Normally it takes a ton of cheese and seasoning to do that."
Only complaint is that the Garbanzo beans were not that soft. Maybe I didnt cooked them long enough or maybe thats just the way they are supposed to be??
I used 3 garlic cloves rather than 4, and it was plenty. 1 1/2 bags of fresh spinach rather than frozen, and it was great. I would make again
Served over coconut rice. Awesome!!!!

Surprisingly, my family loved this! (They aren't so keen on spinach, historically.) We tried it because we got interested in Spain and Portugal recently. The video recommended a sprinkle of lemon juice at the end, which does enhance the flavors magically. I used a bunch of fresh spinach and removed the stems, then chopped it all. I also added 1/4 tsp paprika after reading one of the reviews (might try more next time). I added the spices with the garlic, added a little water to keep it from sticking to the pan, and then added the chickpeas after about a minute of spices cooking. I mashed most of the beans before adding the spinach.
One of my favorite side dishes! Love the combination of spinach and garbanzo beans! I usually use fresh spinach but frozen works too.
I used fresh spinach and a extra can or garbanzo beans. Otherwise I didn’t change a thing. My whole family gobbled this up.
I made this with Cannellini beans instead of chickpeas because I did't have any in my cupboard. Next time I'll have them on hand. But, this was so delicious anyway! Either way, it's a good recipe.

I like spinach and I like garbanzo beans but I didn't care for this dish. I followed the recipe and I wasn't pleased with it. I ended up adding white wine and a bit more olive oil after I tasted the original recipe and I still didn't care for it. 

It looks appetizing but this one isn't for me.

Great as a main course or side. It was my main course, my husband had some turkey breast with his. I followed the recipe with some exceptions: I omitted the cumin, instead of onions, I used onion powder. Based on previous reviews about a bit of dryness at the end of cooking, I combined a couple of reviewer's suggestions and added a splash of lemon juice and cream to finish. I used heavy cream. Why heavy cream? Because it's delicious and heavy cream will not curdle with acidic foods or liquids. I also seasoned with salt to taste after adding the salt from the recipe. I enjoyed something new and will be making this again!
Made as written, 2 of 3 kids thought it was good. Me and the hubs both liked it. Like having another way to fix spinach on the stove!
An easy great way to get your veggies, and healthy to boot. Very tasty.

I made this and loved it. I am not fond of Cumin, so when a recipe calls for it I usually use about half of what is called for. I added coriander to this recipe only because I enjoy coriander with chickpeas. All in all a nice dish and I will make it again .
very good and healthy
Delicious. I added a small can of tomatoes and a can of drained black beans instead. Great over rice. Great substitute for creamed spinach.
I followed the recipe as written. Easy to prepare and came out well. I liked it very much, my husband said "It's good". He's not a vegetable guy, so that's a compliment.

Absolutely delicious! I added cauliflower and baby bella mushrooms. I also substituted pinto beans for the garbanzo beans since that was all I had. I sauteed the onions in the olive oil for a few minutes, then added cauliflower florets. After about 5 minutes, I added the garlic, spinach, and beans and added a tablespoon of chicken broth. I covered it and simmered until spinach was wilted. I added various seasoning to taste and spiced it up a bit with a pinch of habanero seasoning. I am trying to decrease my intake of meat and eat more beans for protein and this served as a main dish for me and is quite fulfilling. This will become a staple. Thanks for a simple and great recipe!!!
I made it "as is".... Absolutely delicious !!!! Noting else to add to it....
Healthy, easy and great with lemon
I liked the combination of flavors, but taking a clue from one of Chef John's recipes, added 1/4 cup of pan roasted pine nuts. This gave a very appealing textural difference.
This was delicious! I could have eaten the entire thing by myself - and I don't really care for spinach! I did use fresh chopped spinach, and onion powder instead of onion.

Had this recently at a tapas restaurant and loved it. This recipe replicates it exactly. Very very tasty and easy to make. I used fresh spinach and just wilted it at the end. Also sautéed the onions separately and then added the garlic with the beans because garlic tends to burn if cooked for a long time. Loved the result and definitely making it again. Great dish!!
Loved this recipe! Used a bit more olive oil but otherwise followed the exact recipe. I will be making this again. Super easy and tasty.
LOVE this recipe. I get sick of plain spinach. This had great flavor. Squeezed a touch of lemon at the end.
liked this, maybe needed a little extra garlic and some acid? Used a large bag of fresh spinach
Delicious and easy.
Trying to add more veggies to my diet and to be honest, this one took me totally by surprise! Wow, so easy and it even turned out to be filling. Thanks so much for the recipe!
This recipe has so many of my favorites. So I made it as directed. I will relish the leftovers and make it again. I've got to spice it up just a smidge. I'm open to suggestions other than salt.
Fresh and good and clean. Ate with pita for an easy lunch.

I have made this recipe several times, but I find the strong cumin keeps it from being something I can share with many others. Today I tried putting 1/4 t. cumin and 1/4 teaspoon curry powder (both a bit scant) and I think I found the winning combination. If you have never tried this, 1/4 t. curry is not enough that you consider the dish a curry dish but it gives the dish a tasty flavor.
easy to make. Pretty tasty.
Love this dish!!! Healthy, easy to make. Definitely use FRESH spinach. Makes a world of difference. Thanks so much.
Loved it. Used rosemary in place of cumin added about 1/4 chicken broth and red pepper flakes. Chef400
Excellent
Very tasty. The cumin is what really makes it...lots of flavor. Need to put the serving size though...would like to know how much i can eat at once
This is tasty, healthy, easy and low cal! What more can I ask for? I make it with fresh spinach and sweet onion. Great side dish and delicious for a light lunch the next day.
I forgot the onions but it was still delicious
I forgot the onions but it was still delicious

Slightly mashed the chick peas while cooking and seasoned with salt and pepper. Used fresh spinach and nutmeg (enhances the flavour of green vegetables) in place of cumin. Would add a touch of chicken stock next time.

Hmmm Ive made this recipe twice now and I have to say I'm disappointed. I love all the ingrediets but something about this is off. If I make this again ill probably top with hot sauce or maybe add some red pepper flakes, its fairly bland. I would probably also use fresh spinach and cook with the garbanzos so they are softer.

Didn't make any changes, and will not make it that way ever again. I love spinach,garlic, and garbanzo beans so I thought we would just love this dish. The cumin was awful and it just lacked something. Sorry---Sorry we tried it.

I had some baby spinach I needed to use before it went bad and this was the perfect recipe. Once I smashed the beans worth a fork it did get dry . . . So I just added some beef broth I had in the fridge. I'm pretty sure chicken broth would be good too. I did add some black pepper. Next time I will omit the salt as it seemed it was in the verge of being salty. Great recipe.
Great recipe. Used fresh spinach, which worked great. Will play with other spices, maybe a lemon and garlic combination.
I studied abroad in Seville, Spain and ate garbanzos con espinacas multiple times a week. I can say this was a great rendition of that dish! I personally like the flavor the cumin gives it.
I could literally eat this every night. Love it.
Used fresh spinach and loved it!
It was just okay. The spices really need to be kicked up a notch. I will make again.
Not liking the the cumin in this dish. May try with lemon and parmesan, that might be better.

Deliciuos!! Excpet for the cumni, that I would have skipped it...I liked it very much...smart idea to press the beans! As Naples said, next time I won't use cumin, since my boyfriend just didn't it because of the cumin...he's very picky!
This was an easy side dish with a casserole. I used a bag of frozen spinach (thawed). The bag was 16oz so if you do that if up the salt and cumin to 3/4 tsp maybe but I love cumin.

I just happened to get fresh spinach and was looking for a recipe to use it in and came across this! I used 6 cloves of garlic (I'm Italian after all!) and added 2T butter. Left out the cumin and used the TJs everyday seasoning. DE-lightful as a light meal!!

I thought that this dish was bland and I did not care for the cumin. I then doctored it up with curry powder, picante sauce and cream. It was better but not great. I added dill and it was good. Next time I will leave out the cumin. I am looking for Vegetarian Thanksgiving dishes to serve to my vegetarian family members. Not sure that this is the one.
I use this same recipe, but it's out of my favorite vegetarian book. Tastes great!

I loved this. As others have said; you can really change this up to suit your tastes. I used fresh baby spinach since that's what I had and I prefer fresh to frozen. As others suggested, I added a little chicken stock and lemon juice after it was done as well as a little feta. I did add the cumin but only a sprinkling. It just seemed flat without it.
I added more cumin. If you don't want the dish to be so dry, don't completely dry the spinach

item.name: Espinacas con Garbanzos (Spinach with Garbanzo Beans)
